title: Brit, 30, fighting for life in Majorca after being mowed down by car
text:

A British man is fighting for his life and a German woman died after being mowed down by an "out of control" car on the seafront in Majorca.

Both were struck by the vehicle, said to have been travelling at "high speed", at about 4.20pm on Friday on the Paseo Maritimo in Palma.

The terrifying crash was witnessed by horrified holidaymakers on the Spanish Island.

The car allegedly flew out of control near a zebra crossing, mounted the pavement and then travelled at speed for about 60ft.

On its path of destruction, it is reported it smashed litter bins and traffic signs before striking the two pedestrians and catapulting them onto its bonnet.

Both were then trapped under the car.

The victims were a German woman and a British man who were on holiday.

They are believed to have jetted to the island on Thursday from Manchester.

The woman has been arrested by the Local Police of Palma accused of reckless homicide and reckless driving.

There was massive commotion and distress before police, firefighters and several ambulances arrived, cutting off the road and diverting traffic.

The German woman, 39, suffered multiple injuries and went into cardiorespiratory arrest.

Medics rushed to the scene and battled to save her for more than an hour.

She was declared dead at the scene.

The British man was knocked unconscious after suffering severe head injuries.

He was transferred to the University Hospital of Son Espases in a critical condition.

A spokesman for the local police in Palma, said this morning: “I can confirm that the woman who died was German and our information is that the injured man is a young British national."

He remains in a critical condition in hospital.“

They were part of a group of people who were in Palma and were hit by a car which mounted the pavement for reasons which are still under investigation.

“The driver of the car was a Spanish woman. She passed a breath test. She was held overnight at our police station in Palma and will be handed over to the judiciary for a court quiz later today.“

The issue of how fast she was going is something that is still being looked at and will be the subject of expert tests.“

She was interviewed last night but was not in a fit state to be questioned at length so the question of why she ended up on the pavement is something that the investigating judge will be looking at.”
description: The Brit is fighting for his life and a German woman died in the crash on the Paseo Maritimo in Palma on Friday afternoon
